definition[0]: (1947-) an English football manager and former player who has managed several English clubs. In 2008 after winning the FA Cup with Portsmouth, he became manager of Tottenham Hotspur. As a player, Redknapp spent most of his time at West Ham and Bournemouth. He is known for his Cockney accent  (=way of speaking which is typical of working-class people in east London) and for his skill at buying and selling players.
